info.description:
Leave automates, streamlines, and standardizes the administration and enforcement of all leave policies, the incorrect enforcement of which can put your organization at risk for costly fines and potential lawsuits. The functionality exposed by these resources allows you to enforce leave rules consistently and fairly, and to maintain accurate and up-to-date records.

Refer to the [Leave overview](doc:leave-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
info.title: Leave

tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Foundations](doc:foundations-doc) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve the schedule for an employee associated with a leave case.
tags.name: Employee Schedules for Leave

tags.description:
Leave automates, streamlines, and standardizes the administration and enforcement of all leave policies, the incorrect enforcement of which can put your organization at risk for costly fines and potential lawsuits. The functionality exposed by these resources allows you to enforce leave rules consistently and fairly, and to maintain accurate and up-to-date records.

Refer to the [Leave overview](doc:leave-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
tags.name: Leave

tags.description: This resource allows you to access auditing records for the Leave domain.
tags.name: Leave Audit Records

tags.description: This resource allows you to create and retrieve medical certifications associated with a Leave case. Frequency, duration, and expiration date are parameters associated with medical certifications.
tags.name: Leave Case Certifications

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and update custom fields associated with a Leave case. You can add an unlimited number of custom fields to a case.
tags.name: Leave Case Custom Fields

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and update Leave case defaults. Leave case defaults are used for actions such as adding Leave time through group actions.
tags.name: Leave Case Defaults

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve, update, and generate documents associated with a Leave case.

The particular documents available within a Leave case is based on the Leave Types used in that case. Documents combine templates with the details entered into a Leave case and can be generated as many times as necessary from within a Leave case. A Doctor's Note is a typical example of a Leave Case document. Regenerated documents do not replace older versions; they create a new, dated copy that contains a fresh set of the case's attributes.
tags.name: Leave Case Documents

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and update eligibility requirements for each Leave type. When a Leave type is selected on a Leave case, eligibility requirements are checked against employee data.
tags.name: Leave Case Eligibility Requirements

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Notes attached to Leave cases.
tags.name: Leave Case Notes

tags.description:
This resource allows you to activate, deactivate, copy, create, retrieve, update, and delete notifications configured for a Leave case.

Notifications have two types: limit-based notifications and date-based notifications. These notifications assist the Leave administrator or the employee on the Leave case.
tags.name: Leave Case Notifications

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Leave Case rules, which describe the processing sequence for paid and tracking time amounts. When a Leave case is assigned a rule, the status of the Leave case is changed to Open and you can begin assigning Leave time.
tags.name: Leave Case Rules

tags.description: This resource allows you to access Leave case status types. A Leave case always exists with an applied status. There are currently three predefined statuses.
tags.name: Leave Case Statuses

tags.description:
This resource allows you to view and manipulate Leave cases.

Leave cases are containers that capture data about a particular Leave case. The data captured within a Leave case includes notes, notifications, frequency, and duration. Leave cases facilitate the administration of each leave of absence case. Each Leave case belongs to and is associated with an employee. Leave cases are part of the core functionality of Leave.
tags.name: Leave Cases

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Leave categories for a Leave case. Leave categories segment the leave of absence solution into appropriate groupings. When employees request a leave of absence, they only see the information applicable to the selected category.
tags.name: Leave Categories

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Leave custom fields.
tags.name: Leave Custom Fields

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, or delete a Leave edit, which represents an instance of time that is charged against a Leave case. Each Leave edit contains total paid and tracking amounts.
tags.name: Leave Edits

tags.description: This resource allows you to access Leave events for the Leave calendar. Such events are frequently created by Leave entities such as cases or takings.
tags.name: Leave Events

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Leave Profiles and information associated with Leave Profiles.
tags.name: Leave Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve reasons for a Leave case. Leave reasons are the list of acceptable uses for leave and should include all types of family, medical, or other leave that are allowed through your organization or that are legislated as available to employees.
tags.name: Leave Reasons

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve configuration data associated with a Leave case. Such data includes Leave types in paid segments, tracking segments, and eligibility questions. Data is retrieved based on an employee's Leave profile, Leave category, and reason.
tags.name: Leave Request Configuration

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, read, and update (process) Leave case requests. The Leave request process begins when employees request leave. Following the request, Leave routes requests to the appropriate approving managers.
tags.name: Leave Requests

tags.description: This resource describes the processing sequence for paid and tracking time amount. When a Leave case is assigned a rule, the status of the Leave case is changed to Open and you can begin assigning Leave time.
tags.name: Leave Rules

get.description: This operation returns the schedule for an employee associated with a leave case.

parameters.description: The ID of a Leave case.
parameters.name: leave_case_id

parameters.description: An ID that uniquely identifies an employee. This is not a person number.
parameters.name: employee_id

parameters.description: The start date of a date range in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: The end date of a date range in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: A selection between ALL (Including Leave edits, Shifts, and Holidays) and ONLY_SHIFTS.
parameters.name: select

200.description: Successful retrieval of schedule for an employee associated with a leave case.

400.description: Bad Request.

post.description:
This operation returns auditing records for the specified auditing entities and employees within a date range. If auditing entities are not specified in a request, all entities are returned.

Note: The start date and end date are used to retrieve Leave cases within a date range. Entities of different types may contain different properties.

requestBody.description: Auditing data request context: contains list of employees, start date, end date and list of auditing entities

200.description: Success.

400.description:
• WFL-100046 - A request cannot be empty.
  • WFP-90101 - The date or time format is invalid.
  • WFL-100151 - Employee is not specified.
  • WFL-100065 - Start date is required.
  • WFL-100066 - End date is required.
  • WFL-100040 - The date range is invalid. The start date must be on or before the end date.
  • WFL-100276 - The audit entity type is invalid. Allowed types include: {types}.

403.description:
• WFP-90005 - Operation not permitted. User does not have access to MGR_LEAVE_AUDIT_ACCESS with action ALLOWED.
  • WFP-90005 - Operation not permitted. User does not have access to SA_VIEW_AUDIT_TRAIL with action ALLOWED.
  • WFP-90005 - Operation not permitted. User does not have access to EA_VIEW_AUDIT_TRAIL with action ALLOWED.
  • WFP-90005 - Operation not permitted. User does not have access to the data of other employees.
